qas.question: When did the systematic study of color theory begin?
What type of colors are red and green?
What did Theo van Gogh paint?
How many rays of orange were there in The Night Cafe?
Van Gogh said The Night Cafe was about the contrast between yellow and what color?
What year did color theory first appear?

context: The <a0_0>late nineteenth century<a0_0/> also brought the systematic study of color theory, and particularly the study of how <a2_0>complementary<a2_0/> colors such as red and green reinforced each other when they were placed next to each other. These studies were avidly followed by artists such as <a1_0><b3_0>Vincent van Gogh<b3_0/><a1_0/>. Describing his painting, <b4_0>The Night Cafe<b4_0/>, to his brother Theo in <b7_0>1888<b7_0/>, Van Gogh wrote: "I sought to express with red and green the terrible human passions. The hall is blood red and pale yellow, with a green billiard table in the center, and <b5_0>four<b5_0/> lamps of lemon yellow, with rays of orange and green. Everywhere it is a battle and antithesis of the most different <b6_0>reds<b6_0/> and greens."
